personality.decision_making_approach: Consensus-driven but can act autonomously when data is clear
personality.risk_tolerance: Moderate – willing to prototype bold ideas but avoids high‑impact production risk
personality.collaboration_style: Facilitator – encourages input, synthesizes diverse viewpoints
personality.stress_management_approach: Scheduled micro‑breaks and short walks; uses Pomodoro technique
personality.conflict_resolution_style: Collaborative – seeks win‑win solutions, uses active listening

other_commitments: Part‑time mentor for a local bootcamp (4 hrs/month)
availability.travel_flexibility: Medium – can travel up to 3 days per month for user research or stakeholder workshops

personal_factors.caregiving_responsibilities: Evenings and weekends for child care; occasional morning school drop‑offs
personal_factors.commute_situation: 30‑minute drive to office on hybrid days; works from a home office otherwise
personal_factors.health_considerations: Mild lower‑back tension; does daily stretching and ergonomic desk setup
personal_factors.career_motivation: Eager to lead a design system team, deepen strategic product thinking, and mentor junior designers

collaboration.meeting_frequency_preference: One 30‑minute sync per project per week; ad‑hoc as needed
collaboration.feedback_style: Direct but supportive – provides actionable suggestions and celebrates strengths
collaboration.knowledge_sharing_habits: Writes post‑mortem summaries in Confluence, runs monthly design‑share sessions

potential_bottlenecks: Heavy reliance on synchronous feedback from product managers (can delay iterations)
Occasional over‑commitment to mentorship activities, reducing focus time
risk_factors.backup_person_needed: Senior UI Designer – Maya Patel (focuses on component libraries)
burnout_risk_factors: Long stretches of back‑to‑back user testing sessions
Balancing child care with early‑morning work blocks
